title: Golfer's Background
question_text: A local golf tournament released a breakdown of the backgrounds of all the golfers. A table of the data is provided below. Continent Relative Frequency North America $0.72$ Europe $0.15$ Asia $0.08$ South America $0.03$ Australia $0.02$ Which of the following is not supported by the table?

choices.text: The majority of golfers come from North America.
Europe has more golfers than Asia, South America and Australia combined.
Asia has more than double the golfers from South America.
South America and Australia golfers make up 5 % 5 % of the field.
Asia has less than half the golfers from Europe.

solution:
Remember: the prompt asks us to find the choice that is not supported by the table.

The table above is an example of a frequency table , but the frequencies are given as relative frequencies instead of counts. It is important to note that percentages, relative frequencies, and rates all give the same information as proportions.

The table given is the breakdown for the background of the golfers in the field. European golfers make up 15 % 15 % of the field, where as Asian golfers make up 8 % 8 % of the field. Since half of 15 % 15 % is 7.5 % 7.5 % , Asian golfer make up more than half of the European golfers, not less than.

Choice 'E' is correct.
